3.84. 
Family property 
1. Irrespective of which spouse owned the property referred to in paragraph 2 of this Article before or after the marriage, it shall be recognised as family property. Family property shall be used exclusively for the common needs of the family. 
2. Family property shall be the following property owned by one or both spouses: 
1) the family dwelling; 
2) movable property intended for the satisfaction of the family household needs, including furniture. 
3. The right to use the family dwelling is also recognised as family property. 
4. The property referred to in paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Article shall acquire the legal status of family property as from the date of registration of the marriage, but the spouses may only enforce this fact against bona fide third parties if the immovable property has been registered in the public register as family property.
